documentation.text: signature aggregator used by the following UserOperationEvents within this bundle.
error case when a signature aggregator fails to verify the aggregated signature it had created.

generate a request Id - unique identifier for this request.
 the request ID is a hash over the content of the userOp (except the signature), the entrypoint and the chainid.

Get counterfactual sender address.
  Calculate the sender contract address that will be generated by the initCode and salt in the UserOperation.
 this method always revert, and returns the address in SenderAddressResult error
 @param initCode the constructor code to be passed into the UserOperation.

params.opIndex: - index into the array of ops to the failed one (in simulateValidation, this is always zero)
params.paymaster: - if paymaster.validatePaymasterUserOp fails, this will be the paymaster's address. if validateUserOp failed,       this value will be zero (since it failed before accessing the paymaster)
params.reason: - revert reason   Should be caught in off-chain handleOps simulation and not happen on-chain.   Useful for mitigating DoS attempts against batchers or for troubleshooting of account/paymaster reverts.

params.deadline: until what time this userOp is valid (the minimum value of account and paymaster's deadline)
params.factoryInfo: stake information about the factor (if any)
params.paymasterInfo: stake information about the paymaster (if any)
params.preOpGas: the gas used for validation (including preValidationGas)
params.prefund: the required prefund for this operation

params.aggregatorInfo: signature aggregation info (if the account requires signature aggregator)      bundler MUST use it to verify the signature, or reject the UserOperation
params.deadline: until what time this userOp is valid (the minimum value of account and paymaster's deadline)
params.factoryInfo: stake information about the factor (if any)
params.paymasterInfo: stake information about the paymaster (if any)
params.preOpGas: the gas used for validation (including preValidationGas)
params.prefund: the required prefund for this operation

params.factory: the factory used to deploy this account (in the initCode)
params.paymaster: the paymaster used by this UserOp
params.userOpHash: the userOp that deployed this account. UserOperationEvent will follow.

params.nonce: the nonce used in the request
params.revertReason: - the return bytes from the (reverted) call to "callData".

params._unstakeDelaySec: the new lock duration before the deposit can be withdrawn.

params.initCode: the constructor code to be passed into the UserOperation.

params.beneficiary: the address to receive the fees
params.opsPerAggregator: the operations to execute, grouped by aggregator (or address(0) for no-aggregator accounts)

params.beneficiary: the address to receive the fees

simulateValidation((address,uint256,byte.details: this method always revert. Successful result is SimulationResult error. other errors are failures.The node must also verify it doesn't use banned opcodes, and that it doesn't reference storage outside the account's data.

params.withdrawAddress: the address to send withdrawn value.
the address to send withdrawn value.

FailedOp(uint256,address,string).notice: a custom revert error of handleOps, to identify the offending op.  NOTE: if simulateValidation passes successfully, there should be no reason for handleOps to fail on it.

SignatureValidationFailed(address).notice: error case when a signature aggregator fails to verify the aggregated signature it had created.

SimulationResultWithAggregation(uint256,.notice: Successful result from simulateValidation, if the account returns a signature aggregator

SignatureAggregatorChanged(address).notice: signature aggregator used by the following UserOperationEvents within this bundle.

StakeLocked(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Emitted once a stake is scheduled for withdrawal

StakeUnlocked(address,uint256).notice: Emitted once a stake is scheduled for withdrawal

UserOperationRevertReason(bytes32,addres.notice: An event emitted if the UserOperation "callData" reverted with non-zero length

addStake(uint32).notice: add to the account's stake - amount and delay any pending unstake is first cancelled.

balanceOf(address).notice: return the deposit (for gas payment) of the account

depositTo(address).notice: add to the deposit of the given account

getSenderAddress(bytes).notice: Get counterfactual sender address.  Calculate the sender contract address that will be generated by the initCode and salt in the UserOperation. this method always revert, and returns the address in SenderAddressResult error

getUserOpHash((address,uint256,bytes,byt.notice: generate a request Id - unique identifier for this request. the request ID is a hash over the content of the userOp (except the signature), the entrypoint and the chainid.

handleAggregatedOps(((address,uint256,by.notice: Execute a batch of UserOperation with Aggregators

handleOps((address,uint256,bytes,bytes,u.notice: Execute a batch of UserOperation. no signature aggregator is used. if any account requires an aggregator (that is, it returned an "actualAggregator" when performing simulateValidation), then handleAggregatedOps() must be used instead.

simulateValidation((address,uint256,byte.notice: Simulate a call to account.validateUserOp and paymaster.validatePaymasterUserOp.

unlockStake().notice: attempt to unlock the stake. the value can be withdrawn (using withdrawStake) after the unstake delay.

withdrawStake(address).notice: withdraw from the (unlocked) stake. must first call unlockStake and wait for the unstakeDelay to pass
